data.text: Oceans and seas make up almost two thirds of the Earth's surface.
Oceans and seas are large areas of the Earth filled with salty water.
Mountains and hills are high places on land. Mountains are higher and steeper than hills.
Rivers and lakes contain fresh water that we can drink.
Deserts are land areas that have very little water. They are often sandy and rocky.
Deserts are land areas that have very little water. They are often sandy and rocky.
